items.content_html:
Summary

  • Changes link from (deprecated) document.styleSheetSets to document.styleSheets for link text document.styleSheets[1] and minor typofix
  • Fixes live sample by changing document.styleSheets[0] to document.styleSheets[1] in the JavaScript code

Motivation

The live sample allows readers to visualize the code on the page, and the proposed correction is also what corresponds with this passage: "We know that the rule we want to alter to do this is contained inside the second stylesheet applied to the page, so we grab a reference to it using document.styleSheets[1]."

Supporting details

I tested the fix locally, and the (fixed) live sample code would also match the Japanese translation, which has a working live sample.

items.title: Update index.md with minor fixes for consistency

items.content_html:
Summary

CodePen link removed because it does not appear on the other overview pages either. So I had the choice of removing it here or inserting it anywhere else.
By the way, there is only one assessment in this module at the moment, so I changed assessments to -> assessment.

Motivation

I looked over the "overview pages" and noticed that little things differ - just for the sake of consistency of the pages...
CodePen is a great suggestion, no question. But for some assessments, after a certain point, you need to insert assets like images, and that's a lot easier with the other examples, like Glitch, and it's even free...
So I think that the removal is justified, but if you see it differently, I'm free to update the notes everywhere else on the overview pages with a CodePen link/suggestion.

items.content_html:
Summary

"Want to test your CSS skills?" sentence removed because it does not appear on the other overview pages either.
So I had the choice of removing the sentence here or inserting it anywhere else.

Motivation

I looked over the "overview pages" and noticed that little things differ...
You can also say that it brings more individuality this way, but I was thinking "because of the consistency of the pages".
If you see it in a different way, I am of course not mad if this PR is simply ignored and deleted. In this case I apologize for the disturbance.

items.title: Update index.md with minor typo fixes for consistency

items.content_html:
Summary

Fixed incorrect description of the document.plugins property value.

Motivation

The document.plugins property always contains an HTMLCollection object even if there are no embeds in the document. For example, document.embeds property works the same way.

Supporting details

https://html.spec.whatwg.org/multipage/dom.html#dom-document-plugins-dev

Metadata

This PR…
-->

  • Fixes a typo, bug, or other error

Fixes #11133: clarify that printing is deferred while the document is still loading.

I also removed the bit about Safari because it was vague and as far as I could tell not true.
items.title: Fix issue 11133: clarify printing on load

items.content_html:
Changed the examples outside of the Example because the link was wider than the web page so the end was cut off as it didn't wrap.
Changed from border to outline because dynamically changing a box model property is not a good example.
Second example was changed to background-color because that is likely something someone would want to do.

Bumps @mdn/yari from 0.6.7 to 0.6.17.

  • c0cbec0 build(deps-dev): bump sass from 1.47.0 to 1.48.0 (#5167)
  • b221562 fix:locale active es locale (#5163)
  • 96fce93 InheritanceDiagram: cleanup code; avoid iframe hack; use single parameter (#5...
  • 5698ff2 build(deps): bump @​mdn/browser-compat-data from 4.1.2 to 4.1.3 (#5161)
  • 095ba1e build(deps): bump dotenv from 10.0.0 to 11.0.0 (#5155)
  • 997aa4b build(deps-dev): bump sass from 1.46.0 to 1.47.0 (#5148)
  • 50fc713 (chore:platform) change default static server port (#5134)
  • ffbd1c8 support building individial translated pages (#5151)
  • 5d81bac build(deps): bump image-size from 1.0.0 to 1.0.1 (#5154)
  • Additional commits viewable in compare view

Dependabot will resolve any conflicts with this PR as long as you don't alter it yourself. You can also trigger a rebase manually by commenting @dependabot rebase.

Dependabot commands and options

You can trigger Dependabot actions by commenting on this PR:

  • @dependabot rebase will rebase this PR
  • @dependabot recreate will recreate this PR, overwriting any edits that have been made to it
  • @dependabot merge will merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot squash and merge will squash and merge this PR after your CI passes on it
  • @dependabot cancel merge will cancel a previously requested merge and block automerging
  • @dependabot reopen will reopen this PR if it is closed
  • @dependabot close will close this PR and stop Dependabot recreating it. You can achieve the same result by closing it manually
  • @dependabot ignore this major version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this major version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this minor version will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this minor version (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)
  • @dependabot ignore this dependency will close this PR and stop Dependabot creating any more for this dependency (unless you reopen the PR or upgrade to it yourself)

items.content_html: Since the example lives in a cross-origin iframe, showPicker() is not allowed. By showing the error with alert(), users understand why it is happening.
items.title: Update example

items.content_html:
On Chrome and Safari, when a request is aborted, its readyState is changed to XMLHttpRequest.DONE (4).

Summary

Change the readyState value when a request is aborted to XMLHttpRequest.DONE (4).

Motivation

I actually tested it in Chrome and Safari, when a request is aborted, its readyState is changed to XMLHttpRequest.DONE (4).

Supporting details

https://xhr.spec.whatwg.org/#dom-xmlhttprequest-abort

items.content_html:
Summary

Adding documentation to Gamepad.vibrationActuator and GamepadHapticActuator.playEffect() following the current Gamepad Haptics API proposal implemented in browsers and providing examples of its usage.

Motivation

vibrationActuator and playEffect are available features on browsers, and besides the proposal document and some random issues on Github, there's no documentation available about them.

Supporting details

  • Gamepad Haptics API proposal
  • Vibrate feature for Gamepad #19
